title: How to Make a Plantable Felt Garden Box

steps.headline: Paint box and add “dirt.”  Cover the entire box with brown paint.
Make carrots.
steps.description:
Cut a large triangle from the orange felt and fold in half. Stitch along the bottom edge. Cut out a circle to “top” your carrot, followed by a few green leaves from green felt. Sew leaves to the orange circle. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Stuff carrot with poly-fil and connect orange circle to the top of the carrot. Sew to close. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0b\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0b\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Create beats using the purple and green felt.
Add some strawberries.
steps.description:
Cut out a circle that resembles a strawberry (so not a perfect circle). Create a pouch that can be filled with poly-fil. Sew top closed. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add leafy green top by cutting out a 4-leaf top. Attach a piece of Velcro to the bottom of the leaf and the top of the strawberry. Put them together to form one strawberry. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Plant your garden.
steps.description:
Stuff vegetables down in between dirt pillow rows. Allow your child to plant and “un-plant” his or her garden. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Plantable-Felt-Garden-Box-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"
